name: GetJobPostings
description:
Retrieve all job postings with category and site filters.

This tool fetches all current job postings from the Workday API. It can filter results based on specific job categories and job sites. Ideal for when you need detailed job listings or want to refine your job search by specific parameters.

parameters.name: job_category_filters
parameters.description: A list of job categories to filter the job postings by. This should be an array of strings, each representing a specific job category.

parameters.name: job_posting_identifiers
parameters.description: List of job posting identifiers for specific job posting anchors.

value_schema.description: Job Posting for Job Posting Anchor

parameters.name: job_requisition_list
parameters.description: A list of job requisition IDs to filter specific job postings. Each ID is a string.

value_schema.description: Job Requisition for Job Posting Anchor

parameters.name: job_site_filters
parameters.description: A list of job site identifiers to filter job postings. Provide job site IDs as an array of strings to narrow down results.

parameters.name: max_job_postings
parameters.description: Specifies the maximum number of job postings to retrieve in one response. Defaults to 20, max is 100.

value_schema.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: response_offset_index
parameters.description: Zero-based index of the first object in a response collection, used with limit to control pagination.

value_schema.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.
